item.title: Report E-2024070693
item.description:
Report E-2024070693

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: BAY SHORE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO- XIY contacted ERTS regarding leaking 1-gallon bottles of Muriatic Acid. It is apparent that the leaking bottles may have had loose fitting caps and therefore improper packaging is the cause of the release. Approximately, 2-liters of product spilled onto the concrete dock floor in a 2’x2’ area. A Contractor contained the release using oil dry and neutralized the product using sodium bicarbonate. One drum of waste was generated for the overpacked and neutralized muriatic acid and one empty drum that last contained the leaking product until a Contractor could dispatch was generated, as well. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024071586
item.description:
Report X-2024071586

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-13
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box was discovered on the trailer wet and torn on the side. The box was put into a hazmat bucket and an admin was called over. upon inspection saw the one container was dented and the liquid leaked out of the cap. The box did not look dented but the box was wet and torn on the corner from top to bottom. there was no packaging inside the container. the box had four separate plastic gallon containers with 1 gallon of product inside. the one container was the only container with a dent and leakage from the cap.

item.title: Report X-2024071613
item.description:
Report X-2024071613

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: QA got called to door 211 at 4:30pm by James the area manager for a leaking box. QA brought a leaker tote and gloves and brought it back to QA area with further inspection found that it was an undeclared hazmat when opening the box. QA quickly started the hazmat process and contained it in a salvage drum.

item.description:
Report E-2024070654

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-ounces of 180100:a:Rubber Rejuvenator were released from (1) 5-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
